alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 14 at 4:29PM PST until February 14 at 6:30PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Western Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 630 PM PST. * At 426 PM PST, multiple dust channels continue to be observed and are spreading eastward into the northern Imperial Valley. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 58 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 8 near mile marker 9, and between mile markers 11 and 28. CA Route 78 between mile markers 1 and 27. CA Route 111 between mile markers 11 and 61. Locations impacted include... El Centro, Brawley, Imperial, Plaster City, Salton City, Ocotillo, Westmorland, Bombay Beach, El Centro Naval Airfield, Fish Creek Wash, Calipatria, Slab City, Coyote Wells, Alamorio and Seeley. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
